poem:
### At Broadview  

The body slams echo  
through suburban streets,  
where once whispers of wind  
carried only the breath  
of sighing trees.  

Tear gas clouds loom  
as the fog of our times,  
leaving eyes to weep  
and voices hoarse,  
while silent watchers record  
the smothering of dissent.
